head.title: Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. - Page #11

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #11 of 32 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Umfreville, Edward. Journal of a Passage in a Canoe from Pais Plat in Lake Superior to Portage de l'Isle in River Ouinipique, 1784. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0030

div.p: From ye end of last Co mentd (Friday 25th) WSW4. to the mo of the Riv. de petite Jour abt 70yds wide, a small round Isld laying off its entrance, in the River WSW¾m. WbS¼ – Wt 300yds – SW1½ to a small lac – across it SWbS3 – in the River SWbS¼ – SSW¼ to Port. le Babbiau, on left side 280yds over, a few wind falls in the road but may be clear'd away with a little Trouble, SSW¼ S.C. & rapid debarked & led ye Canoe – then abt 100yds to another shoaly rapid near ¼m. long – at the end of wch the Port. des Cèdres 170yds long, & good road, then WSW in a spacious opening or rather small lac 1½ to a pt – WbS1m. across a small bay – NWbW¼ to a pt – NW½ – in last Course pass'd where the Riv. discharges itself into ye lac then immediately rod a point to Port. le petite côte de Roche 1100yds long, it is almost choak'd up with willows &c growing in it, otherwise the road is good – from the Port. entd a lac – NW80yds to a pt on Left – W¾ – WbS across a bay to a point of high land 2½ – same Co ¼ to anothr pt then SW3½ to a sandy pt (on arriving here, cross'd over to ye Lt to a pt of high land, having a low Island on the Rt & a deep narrow bay on the Lt, which appears like a River, the reason of crossing over the ye Lt is because the Rt hand Channel is choak'd up with Grass), from hence WbS3 – same Co ½ to a pt – SWbW½ to a pt – Same Co ¼ to anr then WSW1m. to ye mouth of a Channel (which before you enter seems to be a bay, steep rocks on Rt & Lt & abt 100yds wide) Co in it NbW¼ to a point on Rt a bay on Lt – 100yds same Co to another – WbS2m WSW2m. to a pt travers'd across a bay, from hence made a Traverse WbS3½ to a peeked mountain. (Encamp'd in a sandy bay[.])

July 2d Friday. The side of the mountain is the W. side of a bay, in which appears another Channel, which runs Nly from the bottom of the mountain across a Smal[l] bay SSW¾ – SWbW1m. across anr – SWbS1m. across anr – WbS½ 3 Isls on Lt then SWbW½m. across a small bay to Port. la Prairie on Rt side, 470yds long & road in same Condition as ye last yesty – then 126yds to Port. Brulè 160yds long & good road[.] In a River SW150yds. WbS2 – WSW1 – this is generally abt 80yds wide, & steep perpendicular rocky shores, pass'd a small bay on Lt surrounded with perpendicular rocks – then came to Port. d'Artoise 130yds long & good road[,] then enter'd a Swamp, went in it 120yds to Port. la Grande côte de Roche which is 4550 yds long or 2½m. & 150 yds, 1st ½m. sloping up a mountainous rock, the remaindinger part good, part wind falls & part choak'd up, made 3 trips or rests this day, after being oblig'd to clear a passage with our hatchs[.] (Met an Indn with his family on the Port. who was going to Païs Plat, but now means to return with us, St Germaine gives him a bad Character, so that if the other comes up with us we shall be worse off than before.)

3 Saturday. Got our things over the Port. at 2 more rests, then entd a lac abt 1m. long, after which Port. Noir 1430yds long[,] discharg'd on Rt side on a Rock. Port. is incommoded by small woods growing in it, got our Baggage over & encamp on Acct of Rain[.]
4 Sunday. At the end of last Port. a small lac, went to the end of it to a Port. (on Lt side is a communication with another lac, & on Rt near the Port. is a small Cree[k]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
